channel.title: Manage Multi-cluster Projects on
channel.description: Recent content in Manage Multi-cluster Projects on

item.title: Create Multi-cluster Projects
item.description:
This section describes how to create multi-cluster projects.

Prerequisites

  • Application Management for Cluster Federation should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a workspace and have the Federated Project Management permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Federated Project Management permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click Projects > Multi-cluster Projects in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click Create on the page.

  4. In the pop-up dialog, set the project parameters, then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Name

item.title: View Multi-cluster Project List
item.description:
This section introduces how to view the project list.

Prerequisites

  • Application Management for Cluster Federation should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a workspace and have the Federated Project Viewing permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Federated Project Viewing permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click Projects > Multi-cluster Projects in the left navigation pane.

    • The project list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: Edit Multi-cluster Project Information
item.description:
This section explains how to edit project information.

You can edit the alias and description of the project. KubeSphere does not support editing the name of an already created project.

Prerequisites

  • Application Management for Cluster Federation should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a workspace and have the Federated Project Management permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Federated Project Management permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click Projects > Multi-cluster Projects in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right of the project you want to edit, then choose Edit Information from the dropdown list.

  4. In the Edit Information dialog, set the alias and description for the project, then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Alias

item.title: Edit Multi-cluster Project Annotations
item.description:
This section describes how to edit project annotations.

Project annotations are key-value pairs that add additional metadata or descriptive information to a project.

Prerequisites

  • Application Management for Cluster Federation should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a workspace and have the Federated Project Management permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Federated Project Management permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click Projects > Multi-cluster Projects in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right side of the project you want to edit, then select Edit Annotations from the dropdown list.

  4. In the Edit Annotations dialog, set the key-value pairs, then click OK.

    • Click Add to set multiple annotations.

    • Click on the right side of a created annotation to delete it.

item.title: Add Clusters to Multi-cluster Project
item.description:
This section describes how to add clusters to a multi-cluster project.

A multi-cluster project is a project created based on multiple clusters. Resources in a multi-cluster project can run on different clusters.

Note

To run a multi-cluster project on multiple clusters, the workspace to which the multi-cluster project belongs must be authorized to access multiple clusters. For more information, see Create Workspaces.

item.title: Delete Multi-cluster Projects
item.description:
This section explains how to delete projects.

Warning

Once a project is deleted, it cannot be recovered, and all resources within the project will be deleted. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • Application Management for Cluster Federation should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a workspace and have the Federated Project Management permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".
